action.action-desc: Mr. Waltz (for himself and Ms. Houlahan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to prohibit the establishment or maintenance of a unit of the Junior Reserve Officers’ Training Corps at an educational institution owned, operated, or controlled by the Chinese Communist Party.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Funding JROTC at CCP-Owned Schools Act.

section.header: Prohibition of establishment or maintenance of a unit of the Junior Reserve Officers' Training Corps at an educational institution owned, operated, or controlled by the Chinese Communist Party
section.text: Section 2031 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: No unit may be established or maintained at an educational institution that is owned, operated, or controlled by a person that—

paragraph.text: is the People’s Republic of China;
is a member of the Chinese Communist Party;
is a member of the People’s Liberation Army;

is identified by the Secretary of Defense under section 1260H(a) of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (10 U.S.C. 113 note) as a Chinese military company;
is included in the Non-SDN Chinese Military-Industrial Complex Companies List published by the Department of the Treasury; or
is owned by or controlled by or is an agency or instrumentality of any person described in paragraphs (1) through (5).
